definition[0]: to show or suggest that someone is involved in a crime or dishonest act
example[0]: The allegations implicated Abe to such an extent he was forced to resign.
example[1]: Three police officers are implicated in the cover-up.
definition[1]: if something is implicated in something bad or harmful, it is shown to be its cause
example[2]: Viruses are known to be implicated in the development of some cancers.
explanation[0]: Implicate is usually passive in this meaning
